text: A samara is an achene, a type of dry winged botanical fruit.botanical fruit = seed with covering tissue, but not a fruit in ordinary speech. The shape of a samara enables the wind to carry the seed farther away than regular seeds from the parent tree: * The seed can be in the centre of the wing, like the elms and the hoptree. * The seed can be on one side, with the wing extending to the other side, making the seed self rotate it falls. ==References== ==Further reading== *Ralph Lorenz 2006. Spinning flight: dynamics of frisbees, boomerangs, samaras and skipping stones, , Copernicus New York. Category:Fruits Category:Plant anatomy
title: Samara (fruit)
